channel.title: AnxieTea Party
channel.description: I'm Kathy Hopkins and am full of anxieties. Even so, it would be no fun to go fetal in a corner whilst becoming Crazy Hermit Lady. With a nervous stomach (and rambling. plenty of rambling.) I'll explore in my podcast different anxieties (sometimes with guests) and ways to deal.
channel.itunes:author: Kathy Hopkins
channel.itunes:summary: I'm Kathy Hopkins and am full of anxieties. Even so, it would be no fun to go fetal in a corner whilst becoming Crazy Hermit Lady. With a nervous stomach (and rambling. plenty of rambling.) I'll explore different anxieties (sometimes with guests) and ways to deal.
channel.itunes:subtitle: There will be plenty of rambling and beverages.

item.title: #63 - Saving America with Larry Longstreth
item.description: After an intro regarding the passing of Robin Williams that was reported during the recording of this episode, Larry and I delve into how filmmaking has seemed to change over the years and how he prefers to stretch the boundaries. Appropriately enough, we also discuss humor as a tool to cope with sensitive topics. Donate to the indiegogo campaign and get Mitch & Tanner Save America out there!
item.itunes:subtitle: After an intro regarding the passing of Robin Williams that was reported during the recording of this episode, Larry and I delve into how filmmaking has seemed to change over the years and how he prefers to stretch the boundaries. Appropriately enough, we

item.title: #62 - Gameshows and GISHWHES
item.description: Sarah Goldberg returns to talk about our day at The Price Is Right, then the upcoming week of chaotic fun that is GISHWHES, a scavenger hunt run in part by Misha Collins. She also discusses how it made a personal impact.
item.itunes:subtitle: Sarah Goldberg returns to talk about our day at The Price Is Right, then the upcoming week of chaotic fun that is GISHWISHES, a scavenger hunt run in part by Misha Collins. She also discusses how it made a personal impact.

item.title: #61 - Pro wrestler Joey Image
item.description: Joey is a professional wrestler from Jersey who has been dealing for over a year now with multiple back injuries and being unable so far to return to the ring. We discuss his career and his current focus on staying involved with the profession while also healing.
item.itunes:subtitle: Joey is a professional wrestler from Jersey who has been dealing for over a year now with multiple back injuries and being unable so far to return to the ring. We discuss his career and his current focus on staying involved with the profession while also

item.title: #60 - The Great Migration recap
item.description: In this slightly delirious episode, I recap with Adam Scherer my move from Seatlle to LA. A bit sleep deprived and delirious, so we, of course, discuss Facebookings.
item.itunes:subtitle: In this slightly delirious episode, I recap with Adam Scherer my move from Seatlle to LA. A bit sleep deprived and delirious, so we, of course, discuss Facebookings.

item.title: #59 - Really real estate
item.description: A brief solo ep, recorded from a superclassy hotel room in Oregon, in which I talk about the emotional crap from getting a house ready for sale and the migration to LA from Seattle thus far. Never underestimate the workload. Seriously.
item.itunes:subtitle: A brief solo ep, recorded from a superclassy hotel room in Oregon, in which I talk about the migration to LA from Seattle thus far. Never underestimate the workload. Seriously.

item.title: #58 - Adam Scherer loves the box
item.description: In which we discuss Adam's move from Atlanta to LA in 2008 to pursue a career in entertainment as a voice actor, writer, and behind-the-camera guy, and how easy it can be to want to give up.
item.itunes:subtitle: In which we discuss Adam's move from Atlanta to LA in 2008 to pursue a career in entertainment as a voice actor, writer, and behind-the-camera guy, and how easy it can be to want to give up.

item.title: #57 - Nerf Herding with Vlad Neko, pt 2
item.description: In part 2, we discuss his then-impeding surgery (everything went well), podcasting stresses, and comedic grocery purchases.
item.itunes:subtitle: In part 2, we discuss his then-impeding surgery (everything went well), podcasting stresses, and comedic grocery purchases.

item.title: #56 - Nerf Herding with Vlad Neko, pt 1
item.description: In which we discuss Nerf wars, Nerf Herder Podcast, sexuality from more of a teenage perspective, pressure from society to fit in, and more.
item.itunes:subtitle: In which we discuss Nerf wars, Nerf Herder Podcast, sexuality from more of a teenage perspective, pressure from society to fit in, and more.

item.title: #55 - Adventures in bodypainting with Latoyia Blount
item.description: In which we discuss vidja games, cosplay (Vorel Darastrix on Facebook), our shared bodypainting experience during ECCC, and all sorts of other geekery.
item.itunes:subtitle: In which we discuss vidja games, cosplay (Vorel Darastrix on Facebook), our shared bodypainting experience during ECCC, and all sorts of other geekery.

item.title: #54 - Propping up Bill Doran
item.description: In which Bill discusses leaving his regular day job to start Punished Props, his prop-making business that specializes in cosplay, as well as how he found motivation to drop 60 pounds and get super fit.
item.itunes:subtitle: In which Bill discusses leaving his regular day job to start Punished Props, his prop-making business that specializes in cosplay, as well as how he found motivation to drop 60 pounds and get super fit.

item.title: #53 - Judge not my purse
item.description: A solo episode in which I look at the odd way we tend to evaluate others over something superficial or without knowing much of the story.
item.itunes:subtitle: A solo episode in which I look at the odd way we tend to evaluate others over something superficial or without knowing much of the story.

item.title: #52 - Bringing Christmas with Sarah Goldberg, pt 2
item.description: We dig more into what we began discussing in part one, including the realization of Sarah's mother having a bigger condition than most previously had considered.
item.itunes:subtitle: We dig more into what we began discussing in part one, including the realization of Sarah's mother having a bigger condition than most previously had considered.

item.title: #51 - Truffle PTSD with Sarah Goldberg, pt 1
item.description: We discuss in this two-part episode eating curdled truffles in a crowd, medically necessary cats, and Sarah's discovery that her mother tends to exhibit manic behavior.
item.itunes:subtitle: We discuss in this two-part episode eating curdled truffles in a crowd, medically necessary cats, and Sarah's discovery that her mother tends to exhibit manic behavior.

item.title: #50 - Googling butts with Jaden
item.description: My 9-year-old son Jaden wanted to see how the podcast is made. While he learns how it works, we discuss troubles in class and how he feels about us moving to Los Angeles this summer. Kid attention span = short episode.
item.itunes:subtitle: My 9-year-old son Jaden wanted to see how the podcast is made. While he learns how it works, we discuss troubles in class and how he feels about us moving to Los Angeles this summer.

item.title: #49 - Jennifer Blanc-Biehn & Michael Biehn
item.description: In which we discuss functional alcoholism, self-image issues, bullying, and doing things for the love of it. Check out their bbbasement fan site for more info on upcoming projects and potential contests for members!
item.itunes:subtitle: In which we discuss functional alcoholism, self-image issues, bullying, and doing things for the love of it.

item.title: Michael Gaines thinks too much
item.description: In this episode, we discuss the anxieties of starting and continuing podcasts, creating original content, finding compatible cohosts, and more, all while drinking tasty beer in honor of St. Patrick's Day.
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode, we discuss the anxieties of starting and continuing podcasts, creating original content, finding compatible cohosts, and more, and while drinking tasty beer in honor of St. Patrick's Day.

item.title: The Great Migration. Again.
item.description: I'm selling my house and moving from Seattle to Los Angeles this summer, and have a pile of worries/fears to work out before then. In this solo ep, I babble on about the source of my issues regarding this impending move, including growing up without my own residential stability.
item.itunes:subtitle: I'm selling my house and moving from Seattle to Los Angeles this summer, and have a pile of worries/fears to work out before then. In this solo ep, I babble on about the source of my issues regarding this impending move, including growing up without my ow

item.title: #46 - Interpretive kickball with Galen Howard
item.description: Galen's in a new indie film released by Lionsgate, Children of Sorrow, about falling into a cult. We discuss his role, experience as an actor, and a quirky childhood in which parents actually encouraged his creative growth, even through therapy.
item.itunes:subtitle: Galen's in a new indie film released by Lionsgate, Children of Sorrow, about falling into a cult. We discuss his role, experience as an actor, and a quirky childhood in which parents actually encouraged his creative growth, even through therapy.

item.title: #45 - Grandpa's medicine with Joe Rivera
item.description: In which I discuss with Joe Rivera nerdiness, adult beverages, comedy, arrogance, and the work behind starting the new site Next Level Geek.
item.itunes:subtitle: In which I discuss with Joe Rivera nerdiness, adult beverages, comedy, arrogance, and the work behind starting the new site Next Level Geek.

item.title: #44 - Julianne Gabert on the six degrees of Jen Aniston's butt
item.description: Julianne Gabert, who I met through the internets without being murdered, talks of life in Los Angeles, acting, and being part of a startup website called Next Level Geek. Also something about a red butthole.
item.itunes:subtitle: Julianne Gabert, who I met through the internets without being murdered, talks of life in Los Angeles, acting, and being part of a startup website called Next Level Geek. Also something about a red butthole.

item.title: #43 - To Fund A Monster
item.description: In which I discuss the anxieties of attempting to finance the indie film To Find A Monster with producers Joshua Porter, Matthew Donaldson, and Amelia Belle, and actress Alanna Ubach. We discuss also their reasons behind wanting to create this 80's love letter of a film about two boys wanting to become the youngest horror filmmakers ever.
item.itunes:subtitle: In which I discuss the anxieties of attempting to finance the indie film To Find A Monster with producers Joshua Porter, Matthew Donaldson, and Amelia Belle, and actress Alanna Ubach. We discuss also their reasons behind wanting to create this 80's love l

item.title: #42 - Dan Fogler
item.description: In which actor Dan Fogler and I discuss his film Don Peyote, the show pilot he's filming, voice acting, and any other random thing that pops up.
item.itunes:subtitle: In which actor Dan Fogler and I discuss his film Don Peyote, the show pilot he's filming, voice acting, and any other random thing that pops up.

item.title: #41 - Procrastination vs Avoidance
item.description: I realize my content hasn't had nearly enough depth lately, so in this episode I discuss my thoughts on it and my plan going forward. Perhaps I have been afraid to get into details with guests for certain reasons, and maybe have been avoiding things rather than procrastinating. This is me going on record about working on all of that.
item.itunes:subtitle: I realize my content hasn't had nearly enough depth lately, so in this episode I discuss my thoughts on it and my plan going forward. Perhaps I have been afraid to get into details with guests for certain reasons, and maybe have been avoiding things rathe

item.title: #40 - Ashley Paramore
item.description: Ashley (@healthyaddict) joins me to discuss how she got into atheism and began producing content of that and the nerdy variety. I learn how growing up in a closed-minded town actually caused her to find her outlet and more of her identity through interactions online, and for the better.
item.itunes:subtitle: Ashley (@healthyaddict) joins me to discuss how she got into atheism and began producing content of that and the nerdy variety. I learn how growing up in a closed-minded town actually caused her to find her outlet and more of her identity through interact

item.title: #39 - NMX, CES, and the plague
item.description: I avoided subjecting a guest to my con-plague (thanks, Vegas!) and recorded this solo ep about New Media Expo, CES, Michael Bay's freezeup, and FOX News not getting the point of a Muse headband's de-stressifying abilities.
item.itunes:subtitle: I avoided subjecting a guest to my con-plague (thanks, Vegas!) and recorded this solo ep about New Media Expo, CES, Michael Bay's freezeup, and FOX News not getting the point of a Muse headband's de-stressifying abilities.

item.title: #38 - Wendy leaves no cabbage behind
item.description: In which Wendy, aka @Nerdrage42, discusses with me nerdy things (as the name implies), having anxiety and ADHD, and both the fun and challenges of being mom to both a teenage and almost-teenage boy, one being autistic. I met this lady when she worked at Archie McPhee, so you KNOW she's entertaining.
item.itunes:subtitle: In which Wendy, aka @Nerdrage42, discusses with me nerdy things (as the name implies), having anxiety and ADHD, and both the fun and challenges of being mom to both a teenage and almost-teenage boy, one being autistic.

item.title: #37 - Just keep swimming
item.description: Yet another solo episode, this time in which I discuss car theft, plans to attend New Media Expo, getting media cred for a Comic Con, the drama of my almost-job, and the idea of building up and moving on.
item.itunes:subtitle: Yet another solo episode, this time in which I discuss car theft, plans to attend New Media Expo, getting media cred for a Comic Con, the drama of my almost-job, and the idea of building up and moving on.

item.title: #36 - Christy Wise nerds out loud
item.description: Christy, who is co-host on the Nerd Out Loud podcast, discusses what happened to her Personal Assistant job after the person she was assisting died, how an alcoholic mother reacted incredibly wrong to her husband being gay, and the joys of podcast monetization.
item.itunes:subtitle: Christy, who is co-host on the Nerd Out Loud podcast, discusses what happened to her Personal Assistant job after the person she was assisting died, how an alcoholic mother reacted incredibly wrong to her husband being gay, and the joys of podcast monetiz

item.title: #35 - Jay Hollingsworth, Master Debater
item.description: In which we discuss Jay's stand-up career, including hosting at Parlor Live in Bellevue, WA, and then delve into his frequent moves as a child and how it may be affecting life today.
item.itunes:subtitle: In which we discuss Jay's stand-up career, including hosting at Parlor Live in Bellevue, WA, and then delve into his frequent moves as a child and how it may be affecting life today.

item.title: #34 - Sevens dollars per hour with Clarke Wolfe
item.description: Clarke is a horror geek who has done a pile o' hosting gigs, including cohosting the Bloodcast. Here we discuss that and how to NOT be a pretentious poohead in the industry.
item.itunes:subtitle: Clarke is a horror geek who has done a pile o' hosting gigs, including cohosting the Bloodcast. Here we discuss that and how to NOT be a pretentious poohead in the industry.

item.title: #33 - Inside Tromaville with Lloyd Kaufman
item.description: In which I have a fantastic chat with the creator of The Toxic Avenger and head of Troma Entertainment. Yeah. Mind blown. This guy also put out Trey Parker & Matt Stone's first movie, Cannibal! The Musical, and brought Hayao Miyazaki to the States. So there's that.
item.itunes:subtitle: In which I have a fantastic chat with the creator of The Toxic Avenger and head of Troma Entertainment. Yeah. Mind blown. This guy also put out Trey Parker & Matt Stone's first movie, Cannibal! The Musical, and brought Hayao Miyazaki to the States. So the

item.title: #32 - Poolside with Dian Bachar
item.description: Dian is best known as Choda Boy in Orgazmo and Squeak in BASEketball, plus several voice acting gigs for South Park. He is also freakin awesome overall and stars in the upcoming "Fhs Murders of Brandywine Theater". Listen to us discuss the things!
item.itunes:subtitle: Dian is best known as Choda Boy in Orgazmo and Squeak in BASEketball, plus several voice acting gigs for South Park. He is also freakin awesome overall and stars in the upcoming "The Murders of Brandywine Theater". Listen to us discuss the things!

item.title: #31 - Sarah Skilling made Danny laugh
item.description: Sarah is a stand-up comic who did very well in the Make Danny Laugh competition in Bellevue, WA, so I snagged her to talk about far too many awesome things. Of course.
item.itunes:subtitle: Sarah is a stand-up comic who did very well in the Make Danny Laugh competition in Bellevue, WA, so I snagged her to talk about far too many awesome things. Of course.

item.title: #30 - Taking a breather with Marine, pt 2
item.description: Things deteriorate post beer run, but we get to the anxiety of flying and Marine's use of hypnotherapy.
item.itunes:subtitle: Things deteriorate post beer run, but we get to the anxiety of flying and Marine's use of hypnotherapy.

item.title: #29 - Taking a breather with Marine Madesclaire, pt 1
item.description: In which we say many naughty words, drink many beers, and summarize the evening's comedy club adventures.
item.itunes:subtitle: In which we say many naughty words, drink many beers, and summarize the evening's comedy club adventures.

item.title: #28 - Dory fish memory with Darrell Skeels
item.description: In which Darrell, co-host of This Week in Trek, discusses social anxieties, free Starbucks, and kidlet poo.
item.itunes:subtitle: In which Darrell, co-host of This Week in Trek, discusses social anxieties, free Starbucks, and kidlet poo.

item.title: #27 - Cheer up. Do it. Now.
item.description: I ramble on in this ep about my current bout of depression, which was likely brought on by huge life changes. Pure comedy!
item.itunes:subtitle: I ramble on in this ep about my current bout of depression, which was likely brought on by huge life changes. Pure comedy!

item.title: #26 - Papa Bakes, hashtag Floodgates
item.description: Eric Baker, aka Papa Bakes, on his move to Seattle to become a gigantically famous rap-star.  Clearly, he's well on his way. (this description was not, in fact, written by Papa Bakes.) #floodgates
item.itunes:subtitle: Eric Baker, aka Papa Bakes, on his move to Seattle to become a gigantically famous rap-star. Clearly, he's well on his way. (this description was not, in fact, written by Papa Bakes.) #floodgates

item.title: #25 - Extreme Knitting with Jason Perlman
item.description: In which we discuss Jason's career in front of and behind the camera, often for Nickelodeon and Nerdist, and how he learned beach time does not necessarily equal dying in a gutter.
item.itunes:subtitle: In which we discuss Jason's career in front of and behind the camera, often for Nickelodeon and Nerdist, and how he learned beach time does not necessarily equal dying in a gutter.

item.title: #24 - Paul Gilmartin
item.description: Paul Gilmartin from The Mental Illness Happy Hour joins me to talk of how our podcasts helped us deal with ourselves. He also eats a crepe. Enjoy!
item.itunes:subtitle: Paul Gilmartin from The Mental Illness Happy Hour joins me to talk of how our podcasts helped us deal with ourselves. He also eats a crepe. Enjoy!

item.title: #23 - Trendy booty with Molly McIsaac
item.description: In which we discuss Molly's upcoming SyFy channel reality show Fangasm, The Geeky Peacock, and overcoming the effects of bullying.
item.itunes:subtitle: In which we discuss Molly's upcoming SyFy channel reality show Fangasm, The Geeky Peacock, and overcoming the effects of bullying.

item.title: #22 - The CHINS Petition
item.description: In which I discuss the CHINS Petition, Crisis Residential Center, and juvenile detention... and how they all helped me get away from my abuser.
item.itunes:subtitle: In which I discuss the CHINS Petition, Crisis Residential Center, and juvenile detention... and how they all helped me get away from my abuser.

item.title: #21 - Cait Hammer, PAX Prime cosplaya
item.description: In which we discuss cosplay problems, loot looters, and how depression interferes with making a thing.
item.itunes:subtitle: In which we discuss cosplay problems, loot looters, and how depression interferes with making a thing.

item.title: #20 - Moral mathematical compass
item.description: A solo episode in which I discuss child abuse, creepers, and makeshift weaponry.
item.itunes:subtitle: A solo episode in which I discuss child abuse, creepers, and makeshift weaponry.

item.title: #19 - Charles Muir, the Word Ninja
item.description: GoFundMe donor Charles Muir and I finally found time to discuss unfortunate teenage choices, dysthymia and FCWriters.com
item.itunes:subtitle: GoFundMe donor Charles Muir and I finally found time to discuss unfortunate teenage choices, dysthymia and FCWriters.com

item.title: #18 - Ivy league farts with Erica Rhodes
item.description: Here I discuss with Erica Rhodes her varied experience from NPR's A Prairie Home Companion to Plague Town to stand-up comedy... and then some, as well as how her recent diagnosis adds extra "fun" to her acting career.
item.itunes:subtitle: Here I discuss with Erica Rhodes her varied experience from NPR's A Prairie Home Companion to Plague Town to stand-up comedy... and then some, as well as how her recent diagnosis adds extra "fun" to her acting career.

item.title: #17 - Straighten your pictures with David Wall
item.description: In which David Wall talks about starting a web business, Good Road Network, while working with anxieties and then some.
item.itunes:subtitle: In which David Wall talks about starting a web business, Good Road Network, while working with anxieties and then some.

item.title: #16 - Mustard in the Fillion sandwich- with Mel Schmitz
item.description: During the SDCC insanity, Mel Schmitz and I found a moment in a Marriott lobby to chat about NerdHQ, grounded celebs, "standards" of geekiness, and her contributions to Hellogiggles.com (http://hellogiggles.com/author/melanie-schmitz). Listen as I work off two $2 margaritas.
item.itunes:subtitle: During the SDCC insanity, Mel Schmitz and I found a moment in a Marriott lobby to chat about NerdHQ, grounded celebs, "standards" of geekiness, and her contributions to Hellogiggles.com. Listen as I work off two $2 margaritas.

item.title: #15 - Brian Ibbott
item.description: In this episode, I snag Brian Ibbott (Twitter: @Coverville) the day after Nerdtacular 2013. It's a brief one; I babble exhaustedly while further destroying his voice. Listen also for a cameo from the band Same Sex Mary!
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode, I snag Brian (Twitter: @Coverville) the day after Nerdtacular 2013. It's a brief one; I babble exhaustedly while further destroying his voice. Listen also for a cameo from the band Same Sex Mary!

item.title: Ep 14 - Nerdtacular Floorpile
item.description: Blame hypoxia for this one, in which I babble nonsensically with a pile of people I'd just met at Nerdtacular 2013. While we only somewhat discuss anxieties about the convention, this was largely about me recording with many new people at once. It's an exercise in masochism.
item.itunes:subtitle: Blame hypoxia for this one, in which I babble nonsensically with a pile of people I'd just met at Nerdtacular 2013. While we only somewhat discuss anxieties about the convention, this was largely about me recording with many new people at once.

item.title: Ep 13 - Delusion Parade with Justin Robert Young
item.description: In which we discuss, while at Nerdtacular 2013, determining intent behind offensive humor and anxiety of whether to use content on shows. (Twitter: @JustinRYoung)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which we discuss, while at Nerdtacular 2013, determining intent behind offensive humor and anxiety of whether to use content on shows. (Twitter: @JustinRYoung)

item.title: Ep 12 - Giggles do not equal sideboob
item.description: In which Cait Hammer and I discuss the effect of nervous giggling, which seems to range from incarceration to gropey comedians.
item.itunes:subtitle: In which Cait Hammer and I discuss the effect of nervous giggling, which seems to range from incarceration to gropey comedians.

item.title: Ep 11 - Relationship stuff and whatnot
item.description: Cait and I have made horrible mistakes based on anxieties and learned things from our relationships. Let us pass the savings on to you, including the joy of a "Draft" folder.
item.itunes:subtitle: Cait and I have made horrible mistakes based on anxieties and learned things from our relationships. Let us pass the savings on to you, including the joy of a "Draft" folder.

item.title: Ep 10 - Like A Redheaded Stepchild
item.description: In this solo ep, learn how I developed such craptastic anxieties in the first place. It's a happy one!
item.itunes:subtitle: In this solo ep, learn how I developed such craptastic anxieties in the first place. It's a happy one!

item.title: AnxieTea Party #9 - Kathy and Cait's Excellent Adventure
item.description: Join me and Cait on a delightful travel montage to L.A. as we deal with anxieties about the trip and scheduled guests. There was much alcohol and an anxiety attack... or two.
item.itunes:subtitle: Join me and Cait on a delightful travel montage to L.A. as we deal with anxieties about the trip and scheduled guests. There was much alcohol and an anxiety attack... or two.

item.title: AnxieTea Party #8 - Lunch break car naps
item.description: Gary Fisher (Twitter: @The_Lan_Guru) talks with me about anxiety issues in his family and the joys of medication. I brilliantly left the recorder's windscreen in Seattle, so please excuse the occasional "whoosh".
item.itunes:subtitle: Gary Fisher (Twitter: @The_Lan_Guru) talks with me about anxiety issues in his family and the joys of medication.

item.title: AnxieTea Party #7 - Lesley puts stuff on her rabbit
item.description: Lesley Victorine runs stuffonmyrabbit.tumblr.com. She also learned four days after having her first kid (five hours from home) that internet trolls were passing off her work as their own. In this episode, Lesley discusses handling the trolls and Stuff on My Rabbit, plus cracks jokes about delivering her son. (Twitter: @SOMRofficial) Check out http://www.anxieteaparty.com!
item.itunes:subtitle: Lesley discusses handling the trolls & Stuff on My Rabbit (@SOMRofficial), plus cracks jokes about delivering her son.

item.title: AnxieTea Party #6 - It's Anne Wheaton!
item.description: Yes, THE Anne Wheaton (Twitter: @AnneWheaton), who is much more than wife of Wil Wheaton. We chatted outside a fantastic coffee shop in Burbank, CA about ugly crying, anxiety attacks, handling chaotic conventions, and how Nathan Fillion gives her gas.
item.itunes:subtitle: Yes, THE Anne Wheaton (Twitter: @AnneWheaton), who is much more than wife of Wil Wheaton. We chatted outside a fantastic coffee shop in Burbank, CA about ugly crying, anxiety attacks, handling chaotic conventions, and how Nathan Fillion gives her gas.

item.title: AnxieTea Party #5 - Riffing with Riff Millar
item.description: Guest Riff Millar (Twitter: @dj_spacemonkey) brings delicious happy tea, biscuits, and a plethora of reasons why the housing market and family piled on the anxieties.
item.itunes:subtitle: Guest Riff Millar (Twitter: @dj_spacemonkey) brings delicious happy tea, biscuits, and a plethora of reasons why the housing market and family piled on the anxieties.

item.title: AnxieTea Party #4 - On the YouTubes with Cait
item.description: Sometimes people met online are murder-ey. Sometimes they end up getting you camera time in costumes... with zero murders. Guest: Cait Hammer (Twitter: @hammer_cat)
item.itunes:subtitle: Sometimes people met online are murder-ey. Sometimes they end up getting you camera time in costumes... with zero murders. Guest: Cait Hammer (Twitter: @hammer_cat)

item.title: AnxieTea Party #3 - Mooching inspiration in Vegas
item.description: My Vegas trip, in which I decided at the last minute to attend the NMX/Podcast Awards, was amazing and motivating. Clearly I found no dead hookers under the mattress.
item.itunes:subtitle: My Vegas trip was amazing and motivating. Clearly I found no dead hookers under the mattress.

item.title: AnxieTea Party #2 - Acting! Yes!
item.description: How the *expletive deleted* do I power through the anxieties to get on stage in front of people? Isn't it safer to quietly occupy a cubicle for the rest of my life?
item.itunes:subtitle: How the *expletive deleted* do I power through the anxieties to get on stage in front of people? Isn't it safer to quietly occupy a cubicle for the rest of my life?

item.title: AnxieTea Party #1 - Pilot-ey Thing
item.description: I finally jumped in and created a thing! In my first episode (hopefully not my last), I explore the delays of doom that, uh, delayed the publishing of such... greatness?
item.itunes:subtitle: A podcast about dealing with anxieties. There will be plenty of rambling and beverages.
